#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Prune Philodendron
#Text=Philodendrons are beautiful plants that need regular maintenance in order to stay healthy .
#Text=Using sharp scissors or garden shears , you can prune the dead leaves and stems from your plant , and also remove discolored and potentially diseased parts of the philodendron .
#Text=With regular pruning , your philodendron can bring you joy for many years to come .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Timing the Pruning
#Text=Decide if pruning is necessary .
#Text=If your philodendron looks healthy , with no dead or discolored leaves and stems , you may not need to prune it at the moment .
#Text=There is no reason to remove portions of the plant if it is in good shape overall ; you can leave it alone and keep an eye on it for any changes .
#Text=Prune if there is dead or discolored material .
#Text=If there are leaves and stems on your plant that are dead or discolored , you 'll want to prune your philodendron to remove them .
#Text=They could stifle the healthy parts of the plant and keep it from growing .
#Text=Discoloration could mean that the plant is diseased in some way .
#Text=You 'll want to remove those areas to keep the disease from spreading .
#Text=Prune if your philodendron is taking up too much space .
#Text=The stems of philodendrons will continue to grow , and soon you may find that your plant is too big for the area where you are keeping it .
#Text=In this case , you can trim the plant to keep it from growing any larger without any harm to the plant .
#Text=Avoid pruning more than ⅓-½ of your philodendron .
#Text=Trim the stems that are too long .
#Text=As your philodendron grows , you 'll notice that some stems grow much longer than others .
#Text=These are typically called " leggy " stems and your plant could look sloppy with a bunch of long , uneven stems sticking out .
#Text=In many cases , a plant is forced to divert more energy to these leggy stems .
#Text=By keeping everything the same length it will help keep the plant healthier .
#Text=This will also help to encourage new growth , once the leggy stems are removed .
#Text=Cutting the Stems
#Text=Sterilize your tools .
#Text=You can use a sharp pair of scissors or gardening shears to prune your philodendron .
#Text=Before you use one of these , you 'll want to soak it in a diluted bleach and water solution , and rinse them very well when you 're done .
#Text=This will keep bacteria from being spread from the tools to the plant .
#Text=Cut your plant to preserve as much healthy material as possible .
#Text=If you 're removing dead or diseased portions of the plant , make sure to cut just below the area in question .
#Text=That way you 're not cutting healthy portions of the plant that you want to preserve .
#Text=Trim the longest or oldest stems .
#Text=Holding your tool at a 45-degree angle , cut the longest stems to make them even with the rest of the plant .
#Text=Your philodendron will look neater , and it will also encourage growth in the rest of the plant .
#Text=Prune your philodendron during active growing periods while the plant is producing new shoots to promote regrowth .
#Text=Wait a few weeks or months after pruning before cutting portions of the plant again .
#Text=Prune the philodendron where the stem meets the main plant .
#Text=In some cases , it will be necessary to remove an entire stem of the plant .
#Text=Typically , this is because the death or disease has spread , or because you want to thin the plant to make it look better .
#Text=Make sure to leave the main stem alone , the one that connects all of the leaves and stems .
#Text=Remove only the offshoot branches and stems .
#Text=Tips
#Text=The healthy stems you removed can be replanted , so that they can grow on their own .
#Text=You can place them in the dirt of the existing plant , or start a new pot with soil .
#Text=Just bury the bottom of the stem in about of soil .
#Text=It will eventually take root and grow on its own .
#Text=You can also put cuttings in a glass of water until the roots are long .
#Text=Then transfer your plant to potting soil .
#Text=You can lightly prune your plant at any time during the year , but should reserve heavier pruning for the spring and summer .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Philodendrons can be toxic to children and pets .
#Text=Make sure to keep them out of reach at all times .
